ygData.subject: Re: Another take on twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Hehe, full bronze isn t serious twinking.  That s someone who wanted to try a tank, but didn t want to go through the pain of buying/wearing pw/leather.
ygData.messageBody:
Hehe, full bronze isn't serious twinking. That's someone who wanted to try
a tank, but didn't want to go through the pain of buying/wearing pw/leather.
Serious twinking is the guy I saw the other day in full steel plate (yes,
every single piece of it) who con'd green to my 22 Ranger.

Ryugen
Bertoxxulous


>From: Charles Lembke <c-lembke@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>To: "'EQ-Monks@onelist.com'" <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
>Subject: [EQ-Monks] Another take on twinking
>Date: Wed, 15 Sep 1999 14:11:35 -0500
>
>From: Charles Lembke <c-lembke@...>
>
>I tend to run many different characters; monk, warrior, shaman, bard,
>cleric, paladin, magician, and wizard. And yes, I twink between them, but
>not outrageously so, and not so it unbalances anything. For example, my
>monk (lvl 10) was generating cash at a healthy clip. So he gave all his
>money to my warrior blacksmith (lvl 19). The blacksmith use the pp to make
>a partial suite of large banded armor for my ogre shaman (lvl 8), who in
>turn is looking for mesh armor in Upper Guk for my monk. I try to make it
>more of a micro economy. If these three characters were owned by different
>people, it wouldn't be a twink at all.
>
>I have no doubt that there is outrageous twinking going on (saw a lvl 8
>ogre
>warrior with full bronze plate), but I think you can twink within reason
>and
>not upset the game balance.
>
>Charles Lembke
>c-lembke@...
>AKA, Raelph, Vulfgange, Argharghargharh, Orpheuss, Matar, and company.
